biography: Biggs was a British army officer in the Royal Artillery who became the official photographer to the Government of Bombay Presidency in 1855. Biggs was appointed to photograph ancient sculptures and inscriptions in Western India. Biggs also photographed the ancient architecture of Beejapur, Dharwar and Mysore, India. Many of these images appeared in the books published in 1866 entitled "Architecture at Beejapoor" and "Architecture in Dharwar and Mysore", with architectural notes by James Ferguson. From 1862 to 1863, Biggs photographed the architecture of Ahmedabad, the capital of Sujarat, India. These images appeared in an 1866 publication entitled, "Architecture at Ahmedabad" with architectural notes by James Ferguson (ULAN).
